hints.content: Start by understanding how to calculate the distance between two integers from different arrays. The distance is defined as the absolute difference |a - b|. Make sure you are comfortable with this concept before moving on.

Consider the properties of sorted arrays. Since each array is sorted in ascending order, the smallest element will always be at index 0 and the largest at the last index. This can help you quickly identify potential candidates for maximum distance.
Think about how you can select elements from two different arrays. You need to ensure that the integers you choose come from different arrays. This means you should iterate through pairs of arrays.

Identify the minimum and maximum values across all arrays. The maximum distance can be computed as the difference between the overall maximum and minimum values. This will give you a good starting point.
Before implementing your solution, consider edge cases. For example, what happens if all arrays contain the same single element? In this case, the maximum distance would be 0.
You can optimize your approach by only keeping track of the global minimum and maximum values as you iterate through the arrays. This way, you avoid unnecessary comparisons.
When iterating through the arrays, maintain two variables: one for the global minimum and one for the global maximum. Update these variables as you process each array.
Remember that the input constraints specify that there will be at least two arrays. Ensure your solution accounts for this requirement to avoid errors.

Once you have determined the global minimum and maximum values from different arrays, the maximum distance can be calculated simply as max - min. Make sure to handle cases where the maximum and minimum come from the same array.
Finally, implement your logic to return the maximum distance. Ensure your code handles all edge cases and adheres to the constraints provided in the problem statement.

questionNotes: You must pick integers from two different arrays.
The distance is defined as |a - b|.
Each array is sorted in ascending order.
There will be at least two arrays (m >= 2).
The maximum number of integers across all arrays is 100,000.
The values of integers range from -10,000 to 10,000.
